graph_title: Number of Violent and Sexual Offences
indicator_available: Violence against the person including homicide, violence with injury, violence with injury, stalking and harassment and sexual offences
indicator_name: Proportion of population subjected to (a) physical violence, (b) psychological violence and (c) sexual violence in the previous 12 months
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 16: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 16.1: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere

SDG_CUSTODIAN_AGENCIES__GLOBAL: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)
SDG_GOAL: Goal 16: Promote peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, provide access to justice for all and build effective, accountable and inclusive institutions at all levels
SDG_TARGET: Target 16.1: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 16.1.3: Proportion of population subjected to (a) physical violence, (b) psychological violence and (c) sexual violence in the previous 12 months
SOURCE_TYPE: Recorded crime data at Community Safety Partnership and local authority level
REC_USE_LIM: Police recorded crime statistics, like any administrative data, are affected by the rules governing the recording of data, systems in place and operational decisions in respect of the allocation of resources. More proactive policing in a given area could lead to an increase in crimes recorded without any real change in underlying crime trends. These issues need to be taken into account when using these data. Annual data is calculated by using the rolling 12 months to December for the year.
